column4: hi all, I've just managed to get wake on LAN working on my server PC running Ubuntu - my only problem is that the setting I used is not persistent across reboots.  How do I make the following change persistant:    sudo ethtool -s eth1 g
is there a config file somewhere?
easiest would be to add it to rc3.d or similar
ok - I'll give that a try
it's a folder in /etc. the rcX.d folders contain scripts which are run when you change from one runlevel to another
just add your own script to rc3.d and call it S<2 numbers><name>
can you paste me an 'ls -l' on the directory where you placed the script and a cat of the script itself?
i see it. can you make it executable?
and if it doesn't work, can you paste me the script itself?
i'm not sure why not. it looks okay
try adding "ethtool -s eth1 wol g" to a suitable script in /etc/init.d/
i wonder why not. i'm getting short of answers here
well, getting short of suggestions more like
have a look here: http://www.howtoforge.com/forums/showthread.php?t=3628 it's pretty much what we've been doing though
have a look at /etc/init.d/networking. then read the manual page for ifup. also worthy of reading: /etc/network/interfaces
